title: Strengthening Leadership Practical Skills: Component-Based Instructional Design: Theory for Mathematics Education Application

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and foundational pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can analyze knowledge components (objects, behaviors, processes) in mathematics curriculum based on instructional design theories
Learners can combine various instructional strategy components to design lessons aligned with specific educational objectives
Learners can develop blended mathematics modules integrated with digital tools using a component-based approach
Learners can self-evaluate the effectiveness of designed instructional modules through project-based assessment
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
